perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from Licensor, an  exclusive, non-transferable (except as set forth in Section 10.7) and non-sublicensable (except as provided in Section 2.1(c)) license to use the  Licensed Domain Names in connection with the Business during the Term. Except as provided in Section 2.3, Licensee's use of the Licensed  Domain Names under the terms of this Agreement shall be free of any fees.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee, and Licensee hereby accepts from Licensor, a non-exclusive, transferable (as set forth in Section 10.7) and sublicensable (as provided in Section 2.1(c)) license to use the Licensed Domain Names in connection with the Business during the Term. Except as provided in Section 2.3, Licensee's use of the Licensed Domain Names under the terms of this Agreement shall be free of any fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants an exclusive license, while the modified text provides a non-exclusive license. Additionally, the license was originally non-transferable and non-sublicensable but it is now transferable and sublicensable. This change creates uncertainty regarding the Licensee's rights to the domain names and could lead to disputes over exclusivity, transfer, and sublicensing of the domain names.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall monitor and censor all Content on the websites associated with the Licensed Domain Names, including  without limitation Content posted by end users. Licensor shall also have the right to monitor and censor Content of the websites associated with  Licensed Domain Names. Licensee shall remove any offending Content, including, but not limited to, any illegal materials, pornographic, obscene  or sexually explicit materials, materials of a violent nature, or politically sensitive materials, from such websites as soon as possible after it becomes  aware of such offending Content but in no event later than the timeframe prescribed by the Governmental Authority after receipt of oral or written  notice from Licensor or such Governmental Authority. Licensee's failure to comply with this Section 3.3(a) shall be deemed a material breach of  this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing obligations, Licensee acknowledges that Licensor shall have the right to remove such offending  Content from the websites associated with Licensed Domain Names.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee may choose to monitor and censor Content on the websites associated with the Licensed Domain Names, including without limitation Content posted by end users. Licensor is not obligated to monitor and censor Content of the websites associated with Licensed Domain Names. Licensee will use commercially reasonable efforts to remove any offending Content, including, but not limited to, any illegal materials, pornographic, obscene or sexually explicit materials, materials of a violent nature, or politically sensitive materials, from such websites within a reasonable time after it becomes aware of such offending Content. Licensee's failure to comply with this Section 3.3(a) shall not be deemed a material breach of this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing obligations, Licensee acknowledges that Licensor does not have the right to remove such offending Content from the websites associated with Licensed Domain Names.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates Licensee to monitor and censor all content and requires the Licensee to remove any offending content within a strict timeframe. The changed text makes content moderation optional, and also removes the strict timeframe. It also states that Licensee's failure to comply with this section will not be considered a breach of contract, which is contradictory with the original text. Furthermore, Licensor originally had the right to remove offending content, and now does not have the right to do so. This change introduces contradictions about each party's responsibility over content moderation.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement and any rights or authority granted hereunder shall not be assigned or transferred by either Party, including by  operation of law, merger or otherwise, without the express written consent of the other Party, provided that Licensor may assign this Agreement  without consent to any of its Affiliates and Licensee may assign this Agreement without consent to SINA Leju or an Affiliate of Licensee that is  controlled by SINA Leju.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement and all rights and authority granted hereunder may be freely assigned or transferred by either Party, including by operation of law, merger or otherwise, without the requirement of express written consent of the other Party, and notwithstanding any affiliation or control.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits assignment or transfer without express written consent. The changed text permits free assignment/transfer, contradicting the original provision. This can create dispute over the validity of any assignment made without consent and uncertainty about who is bound by the contract.
